title: "Learn to play against him" = Game is balanced
body:
I'm getting tired of seeing shit arguments such as this. No matter if the champion is considered out of meta or OP, using that lazy excuse instead of a proper point by point argument is just dumb.

YASUO IS OP! Learn to play against him.
CAMILLE IS OP! Learn to play against him.
LEE SIN IS OP! Learn to play against him.

And this same shit excuse also goes on to the other 130+ champions, which technically means, you're saying that the game is already as balanced as it is. See how dumb you're trying to word it out?

replies.body:
That's kind of the whole point of the game. 

Not only do champions all have their own unique strengths and weaknesses, but they are also prone to change. 

You have to constantly learn to play the game as it evolves. 

It may not be a good argument, but it is accurate.
people only hate yasuo because he's a nuisance. no matter how good or bad he actually is boards will bitch endlessly about him even though his design is fine

Regardless of the state the champion is in or what champion, if you want to climb you should know what their win conditions are how their trades go, their powerspikes and how to avoid them getting fed.

oh so you dont wanna learn strength and weakness of match ups and learn to be better at  the game... you want to blindly pick whatever champ build blindly... play ham and smash your face on the key board and expect to win and if you dont its an issue with the game and not you ?
Then might as well just remove ALL the nerfs & buffs that's going on in PBE.

well why is there buffs and nerfs? cuz people constantly bitch and want change ... so riot makes changes... and it causes ripple effects through the game... for everything they do has a indirect buff/nerf

there is no way the game will every be a "perfect" balance... its more so balanced by being imbalanced
